net.derquinse.common.collect

Class AbstractHierarchy<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.derquinse.common.collect.AbstractHierarchy<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - Type of the elements in the hierarchy.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hierarchy<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImmutableHierarchy

    public abstract class AbstractHierarchy<E>
extends Object
implements Hierarchy<E>
    An immutable and thread-safe implementation of hierarchy.
    Author:
    Andres Rodriguez

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Description copied from interface: Hierarchy
        Returns the hash code value for this hierarchy. The hash code of a hierarchy is defined to be the sum of hash(e)^level(e) for every element e of the hierarchy. This definition fulfills the general contract of Object.hashCode().
        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface Hierarchy<E>
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        The hash code value for this hierarchy.
        See Also:
        Object.equals(Object), Hierarchy.equals(Object)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: Hierarchy
        Compares the specified object with this hierarchy for equality. Returns true if the specified object is also a hierarchy, the two hierarchies have the same size, and both contain the same elements in the same coordinates. This definition ensures that the equals method works properly across different implementations of the hierarchy interface.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Hierarchy<E>
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to be compared for equality with this hierarchy.
        Returns:
        True if the specified object is equal to this hierarchy.
